author: 0xhummingbird
content: When will the bug be fixed?

author: tersec
content: "its been fixed and deployed now". It links to the pull request showing that happening.

author: gaming_in_rust
content: What's the plan for starting a kiln compatible public testnet?

author: timbeiko
content: <@!717458004143898714> we want to stand up a couple short-lived devnets with client versions who support the latest spec, once that's done and we're confident, we'll have a proper public release that's a bit more polished

author: timbeiko
content: You are of course welcome to use the devnets, but just be aware there won't be a ton of infra to connect to them + they will be taken down after about a week

author: timbeiko
content: In the meantime, Kintsugi is still live if you want something that'll be up for a couple weeks, has infra support, and don't mind not having the exact latest spec

author: funnygiulio
content: Hello, Could someone be so kind to give me an example of an `Header` Request in ragards of specs: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/167

author: funnygiulio
content: i get that the JWT encoded claims are in the Header of the request, but under what field? Authorization?

author: funnygiulio
content: also i would like to point out that `iat` is defined to have to be in range +/- 5 seconds from current time

author: funnygiulio
content: which does not make much sense considering that we cannot have issued it in the future

author: funnygiulio
content: if it is issued in the future that would make no logical sense, i think this may be an error in the spec

author: funnygiulio
content: i think the range should be [now, now+5] instead of [now-5, now+5]

author: ajsutton
content: Clock skew between the two nodes could mean it's issued in the future.
